intro: Plananthus recurvus, commonly known as the recurved plananthus, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and gray-green, hairy foliage that helps reduce water loss in its harsh environment. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale blue or violet, arranged in dense clusters along the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to full sun exposure. Due to its unique appearance and resilience, it is often cultivated in xeriscapes and rock gardens.
